title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New Rochelle, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Fast and easy interview process. Everyone was very nice and helpful. Currently going through the onboarding process. HR was very helpful. Had two interviews on the same day and a nursing exam prior.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself What are you strengths What are you weaknesses

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Had to set up two interviews then go in person, video chat. It was very nice being able To talk to everyone. The staff was really nice and didn’t take long.
Interview Questions: What was job experience like

title: Lab Technician II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: It was a lengthy but rewarding process. I had my interview over zoom. To become a Montefiore associate there are a lot of different requirements to meet, however, it is definitely worth the effort.
Interview Questions: Do imyou have experience in (said field)

title: Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was not too difficult. They were very accommodating. First interview was about 20 minutes and another interview with HR about another 20 minutes. I received a response very quickly and offered several start dates to accommodate my vacation.
Interview Questions: What made you interested in this position? Why do you think are a good candidate?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Vetted by HR, quick call with hr specialist asking basic questions regarding my resume, and then i was set up for an interview with the practice director, that lasted about 45 minutes then was set up for an interview with the practice vice chairman, that lasted about 30 minutes. A few days later, hr senior recruiter called me to ask me about my expectations regarding compensation, and then about  two days later, I was offered the job.
Interview Questions: how will you be successful managing multiple locations.

title: Data Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Communication had a lot of delay. panel interview by hiring team. General questions related to previous experience in data analytics. Overall neutral experience, some of Interviewers were not friendly- that reflects the work culture
Interview Questions: How did you use python in your previous role?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Apr 2023
Interview Descriptions: Had 2 interviews, first on the phone with the nursing recruiter. The interview was basic question. Second interview was good. It was with the nurse. She asked my more about experience.
Interview Questions: What is a successful nurse to you

title: Human Resources Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Mar 2023
Interview Descriptions:
I was contacted by the Recruiter and had an initial phone screen. Then she invited me for the in person interview. The interview was more than an hour. They had one and one with each team member. It was really repetitive to answer the same question to everyone. 
1st had the one and one with the Recruiter, 2nd one and one with the HR manager and 3rd with the HR Director. 
And then I never heard back from them. Please respect your candidates and give them feedback with a yes or no, after any interview.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Montefiore?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: It takes 2 months before I was called in for interview. Manager call you to set-up the date and time of interview appt. Casual and easy. Welcoming environment and interviewers were 2 managers. Nice people
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Senior Surgical Technician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: It was very easy and it might have been this way due to my interviewer. Although I think anyone with the right credentials can get into this industry just alright.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest weakness?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: I applied for this position couple months ago. It was not a long wait for me like others have stated. My interview process when something like this: I interviewed with nurse manager Got a call from HR to schedule an interview . I will update the outcome.
Interview Questions: How will you deal with an aggressive patient?

title: Ward Clerk Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions:
basic Application : easy
in person interview with management: be prepared for questions about what you're looking for, your experience, and why you're looking for a new position.
Then phone interview with talent requisition 
then application part one
then application part two
then offer letter
Interview Questions: why you want to work for Montefiore ?

title: MMG Performance Coach Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3+ months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Sept 2022
Interview Descriptions:
This review is for a position within MMG offices in Yonkers, not the hospitals. The interviews consisted of 3 virtual meetings to meet the VP, acting director and 1 coach for the department. The process took about 3 weeks. After all interviews were completed, the VP emailed to ask for examples of past work. In my experience, this is always a bad sign. 
QI/PI work revolves around proprietary and confidential projects privvy to each institution, so asking for samples feels unethical. It feels like they were definitely shopping for ideas for free.
There was no response after submitting the sample work. Just the automated rejection email. 
This department experiences frequent turnover and PI coaches dont stay very long. 
Beware of being asked to submit free content.
Interview Questions: Standard questions regarding project management, ideas for carrying out QI initiatives.

title: Staff RN Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions: It is super hard to get a job with montefiore and they know it. It is even joked about during orientation. You have to interview with HR, then the manager, do two exams, drug test, background check, Physical etc. they schedule all these things on different dates and different montefiore  locations all over the Bronx. very confusing process.
Interview Questions:
Name a time when you went above and beyond for a patient

Have you been late to previous job and what did you do about it. 

What would your previous managers say about you?

title: Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions: First was a call with the director where they asked the typical questions about myself, my experience, certain types of projects I have worked on and how I deal with some roadblocks. After I had to complete a case study and submit it. Then I interviewed with the PM who would be my manager and we spoke about my experience, as well as the answers to my case study. Then I spoke with a member of the project team about my experience in certain situations and how I would go about process improvement and things like that. Then I had an interview with one of the directors and spoke more about my project experience. All of it was on Microsoft Teams through the video except for the first call.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your background

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: Went through a zoom interview where I was asked standard questions such as strengths, weakness, leadership, etc. as well as job specific questions (related to experiences helping underserved populations). Interview lasted about 30 minutes.
Interview Questions: What is your biggest weakness?

title: Nursing Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: After your online application, Send you email  for virtual interview and tips  which is good after 24-48 hours you recieve  a link for the interview and the. You wait if your hired
Interview Questions: What are  your Qualifications and background

title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in May 2022
Interview Descriptions: I received a call from HR and she sent me the skills survey quiz for the references link, asked me to send her my BSN, my RN registration & license, and to complete the full application to the position I applied for. We then had an interview scheduled which went so well. I then received a call from the ED manager for an interview. I was interviewed by the Nurse Educator & the ED Nurse Manager. It was a learning experience and helped me tap into my knowledge from school.
Interview Questions: What is the process of sepsis? How would you go about a 23 year old  patient who comes in with LLQ pain?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: Friendly Conversation. No pressure, they just want to know you! Everyone was very polite and made me feel comfortable. I spoke to three PA's and they were all very nice and they wanted to get you to work there.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose internal medicine?

title: Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Quick and friendly, heard back within a month. Starting process took longer, but the interview was great. The interview itself was a professional and smooth process, but HR was frustrating.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Customer Service Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Feb 2022
Interview Descriptions: Interview was remote because of covid, you get assigned a manager to interview you and a code for the teams log in wait for the interviewer, they come on ask you a few questions and that’s it.
Interview Questions: Name a time where you made a mistake you had to fix

title: Epic Application Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: 3 Rounds: First- Since I come from a non-EPIC background, I was asked to give the EPIC skill assessment exam (I took 1.5 hr to complete), Second - After clearing the Skills Assessment, I had 1-1 with the hiring Manager (1 hr), Third - Final round w/ Manager of Hiring Manager and the Manager of another team that this team that I was getting hired to will be closely working with.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions, Experience related, insights into Role and company

title: Clinical Psychologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: There were a total of five interviews that were conversational. It was overall a great experience. I learned about the program and they were very interested in bringing aboard a candidate who was a good fit to the program and wanted to ensure that the program was a good fit for the candidate as well.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Senior Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Nov 2021
Interview Descriptions: 1 day interview. Meet with director. Wait 3 days for call back . Brief overview of departmental goals and responsibilities. Team strengths and weaknesses. Understanding structure of department what is meeded to succeed
Interview Questions: Greatest strength in yourself Weaknesses

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Oct 2021
Interview Descriptions: The questions were pretty moderate, the interview I had was done over FaceTime. The interviewer was nice and it went well. Hopefully things will work in my favor. I’d hope to soon be employed by Montefiore medical center.
Interview Questions: What’s your 5 year plan.

title: Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: They have you fill a questionnaire, med math, and application of medication administration. 30 qs. if you pass, you go on to the next step. if not, have a good attitude about it and hopefully they allow you to retake it.
Interview Questions: Why do you want this position, ect. What is you goal?

title: Data Scientist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: A 90 Minute interview process meeting with 1 senior data scientist, a team member, and the head of the team. ~30 minutes of technical focusing on database management and the rest was behavioral. Prior to the interview there was a case study that a presentation had to be created for and was reviewed and discussed with the head of the team.
Interview Questions:
Technical portion: asked about sql statements to sort thru a transactional database

Behavioral: primarily going through resume

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: Had an interview in-person with the supervisor and regional medical director, it was mostly behavioral based to assess fit of yourself with the organization. It was not an overly stressful experience, more conversational. We also discussed long term objectives that was in addition to current position job duties, responsibilities and tasks.
Interview Questions: How do you see yourself growing with the organization.

title: Change Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Jun 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process is so weird and poor. First round was with HR then director then HR again, then virtual video and Audi interview, then 200 plus question then with 4 people team interview.
Interview Questions: All stupid question and very unprofessional. They have been looking for more than 8 months now and still not selected the candidate yet.

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Apr 2021
Interview Descriptions: I found the interview process to be very thorough, conversational and respectful. The feedback provided was eye-opening and appreciated. The follow-ups were courteous. I appreciate being kept in the loop.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this field?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: HR requires you to complete 3 reference checks up front, 5 references if they cannot contact your current supervisor, just to even get to sit for an HR screening call. After I completed my 5 references the HR rep told me my salary requirement was too high and wouldn't let me negotiate and discontinued my application. Completely wasted my time and unprofessional as I had to provide references upfront. ***The salary range is 50-60K and you should know this upfront before you start the process!***
Interview Questions: What's your salary requirement no thats too high sorry no I can't tell you what the range is

title: Administrator Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: The interview process took about 2-3 months due to delays at HR. Once it was initiated, it was VERY slow with lots of hold-ups. The HR department was very disorganized and lost many of my documents. The interview itself was easy.
Interview Questions: Questions were specific to my role and my work.

title: Buyer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: Short interview, went over basics of benefits and pay then met the manager and went down to the department. They went over the basics of the job. Very friendly and nice
Interview Questions: What system do you use at your current job

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: it could have been better they are desperate for nurses right now at some of their upstate locations, perhaps the main campus is different but who knows. right now they want you in as fast as possible and don't care too much about the process.
Interview Questions: tell me about yourself today.

title: Physcians Assistant Specialties Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: Multiple staged days, tours, and interviews. Unfortunately delayed due to COVID and not able to fully see what the working environment would be. Slightly unorganized because interviews across multiple sites and hospitals
Interview Questions: What can you bring to Montefiore?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: concise and to the point, met with medical director and working PA. wasn't showed the floor but was explained the duties clearly. interview was more of conversation. wasn't given an offer by medicine department but HR representative called to do separate interview; shortly after gave offer. th
Interview Questions: Why would you choose to work at Montefiore?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: It was great.  Recruiter was so honest with what she was expecting. Told me a suit is recommended especially for first graduates and how she will cancel people out depending on appearance.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here? Tell me about yourself.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: i was contacted by HR for a phone interview. First i had to complete an online assessment and a HireVue virtual interview. the email correspondence was friendly and timely. I was contacted 1 week after applying
Interview Questions: to first complete the virtual interview

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: It was a little lengthy, but overall pretty straightforward. Two interviews on the unit (one with the nurse manager and the other with charge nurses) and one with HR. Had to complete a fundamentals test and a med-math test as well.
Interview Questions: How did you handle a situation with a difficult patient or instructor?

title: PCT Patient Care Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Mar 2020
Interview Descriptions: Is was very good, the questions were reasonable, the interviewer was professional but also made me feel comfortable.  They let me know what I was getting into and I had to understand that you are to help people not to look for a check, which I’m glad they said because I feel the same way, after all these people we are talking about.
Interview Questions: How would you care for a patient

title: Director IT Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Yonkers, NY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: An initial video screen was sent to the hiring manager and then I was invited in to interview directly with the hiring manager.   A good friend who previously worked with the hiring manager warned me that she was a total jerk.  I went anyway to find out that he was completely right.  As soon as the hiring manager asked me if I worked with my friend at my previous company and I confirmed it, she started crapping all over my friend which was extremely unprofessional.  I would never want to work for someone like this.  I would have had a hard time accepting the offer if she had extended it.  She also kept me in her office 30 minutes past the interview schedule end time and never once asked me if that was ok or apologize for infringing on my time.  So inconsiderate!!!
Interview Questions: How many people were on your CAB (Change Advisory Board)...

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview questions, asked about personal experiences directly related to the job.  The interviewer was very caring and wanted to know about me. The initial interviewer was sick and they were very accommodating as to finding someone else to interview me.
Interview Questions: What is my theoretical orientation>

title: PA Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions:
I applied online. and was then contacted by HR, then scheduled an in-person interview with the specific medicine department, they then showed you around. interview was ~30-60minutes.
I applied online. and was then contacted by HR, then scheduled an in-person interview with the specific medicine department, they then showed you around. interview was ~30-60minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself. why do you want too work here?

title: Physical Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions:
Applied online and received call back from HR. 
Set up interview with director.  Likely high chance to receive offer if scheduled for interview
Performed interview in department and completed onboarding process (~3-4 weeks later)
Interview Questions: Why are you a good fit?

title: Ward Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: Went well and didn't last long. They asked basic questions that any interviewer would ask.  Spoke to the HR manager first and then had an interview with the hiring manager. Hired on the spot. They asked basic customer service questions to see how I would deal with patients and their families.
Interview Questions: What does teamwork mean to you?

title: Medical Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview through a talent company? Focusing on a few basic questions about work history, experience and how these can improve and help promptly towards my career (goals).  Fairly thorough and detailed expectations. Straight to the point with a short time frame to prove your skills. I hope I can get in person interview soon.  Nerve wracking at first and they don’t tell you exactly what will happen next. The status is under consideration/pending. Expecting  either a rejection with a “thank you” after a good amount of time. I am writing this review using this site because I am very curious how their hiring process works.
Interview Questions: Tell us about yourself?

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: I went on a couple of interviews, and my interview with HR was the second interview I had out of 3. Once you’re in their system they kind of call you for random units, I finally got a job offer from HR a month after my interview. They don’t say anything regarding your interview while you wait for a call back so you must be very patient.
Interview Questions: Do you have any customer service experience?

title: Art Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: One of the preliminary interview steps is to record yourself, via an app, answering the questions. It was a nerve-wracking. I am not a vlogger or selfie taker, so it felt both meaningless and uncomfortable. You are given as much time as you want to practice, but the actual interview questions are different from the practice questions. The whole thing felt invasive, superficial, and like the employer did not care enough to invest even in a Skype interview.
Interview Questions: Not verbatim, but something along the lines of "how did you handle a difficult situation on the job?"

title: Human Resource Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: The first step of the interview was a video interview.  There were 3 questions and you were not able to review your answers.  A phone interview would of been preferred so that an idea of the company could of been obtained instead of feeling a swipe.  Throughout the process I have learned that the Recruiting team is unorganized and unprofessional. After completing the video interview I received a duplicate email for another request which I later found out that I received the wrong title for the interview (good reason to have a phone interview). I did not receive the position but about a month later I received another interview request, I reached out to confirm it was not in error  and the response I received was curt and unprofessional.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this role?

title: Licensed Practical Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Filled out a form and was given a math test. I passed and was given an interview. I had to interview at different sites. There was a few sites that didn’t get back so I called HR and they called and offered me a position in the next 2 weeks after the interview.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: This was for a position at the Wakefield Montefiore campus, all the campuses are run a bit differently. I applied online and got an email immediately saying that I do not have the minimum requirements for the position. A few weeks later I got a call from the Department asking to set up an interview. Overall the interview was pleasant and the interviewers were very nice. I got an answer from them 3 weeks later.
Interview Questions: What was your worst clinical rotation and why? (I am a new graduate PA)

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New Rochelle, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online. Was emailed for an in person interview. The HR manager was very friendly as well as the nursing manager. Be prepared for clinical questions from the nursing manager. HR also gives a 30 question nursing exam. It was super easy though 15 med math and 15 general medication questions such as "What is the most popular Sub Q location" all multiple choice. Interview questions from HR were typical behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you went above and beyond for a patient.

title: Patient Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I was contacted for a video interview where they ask about five questions. Then  received a phone interview and that followed with a in person interview that same week. The in person interview were with 3 Managers and then an individual with an Administrator. I was then called by HR for a final interview. Please go in to these interviews prepared, they ask a lot of behavioral question, know your background on Montefiore and the position you're applying for.
Interview Questions: Why did you choose Montefiore?

title: PA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: Smooth and informative. It seems like they really care about finding a position that you are interested in. Willing to teach and train. Seems very PA friendly. Overall good experience!
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, and why I wanted the job

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in May 2019
Interview Descriptions:
1. Phone interview with the hiring manager.
2. Phone interview with HR.
3. On-site interviews - every interview was 45 minutes.
Four managers and one team member.
5. Online assessment.
6. Five professional referrals.
7. Background check.
8. Drug test.
9. Physical exam.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your previous position

title: Physician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: Applying for a job and being treated as a low priority prospective employee. The system had massive amounts of paperwork and it led to me not even continuing through with all of the massive and unnecessary beaurocratic work.
Interview Questions: How can you serve the poor population?

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: I met with HR and took a short pharmacology exam. The interview was one on one. The interviewer was very laid back and nice and straight forward. No difficult questions. If you prepared normally you should be fine. I was told a second interview will definitely be set up with me but have been waiting for two months now.
Interview Questions: How did you deal with a difficult patient?

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: One Director called me to schedule the interview. Three Directors interviewed me at once. They were very friendly and wanted to set me up for success in the interview. They were emphasized the importance of the fast pace of the hospital.
Interview Questions: What type of social services have you referred people to, what did discharge planning look like in your previous role, tell me about yourself.

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical in Feb 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interview process feels natural. Be your-self and tell the truth. Some departments may let you fill out a detailed form with divers of questions. Then the one-on-one comes after.  If there is no forms they will ask about your past experiences. In addition, a tour of the hospital may be included.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Pharmacist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with director and some clinical pharmacists. Director will give you a case to figure out and present.  After having a one on one with director, you will be interviewed by the clinical pharmacist who will ask you questions based on your resume.
Interview Questions: What made you apply here?

title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Very Good interview process.  The first step was online with behavioral interview questions and if you pass the online assessment then you will be called for an in-person interview. There are about 5 questions that you will be asked online, so be sure to prepare beforehand. Research the hospital and be ready to answer behavioral based interview questions.
Interview Questions: Why Montefiore? How do you handle a difficult personality, person, situation? Describe how you handled a difficult patient? What is your favorite season?

title: Clinical Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Extensive, took a exam on the day of the interview on clinical skills.  Very dragged out since had to interview with different managers, VP and other staff members.  Then had to go back a few times to interview with other staff members
Interview Questions: All questions were expected

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was casual yet professional. The hiring manager at the time asked what prompted me to join the organization, about my nursing skills, and what I expect from the organization. By answering honestly and expressing a sincere desire to keep learning, I got a second interview which then led to a job offer.
Interview Questions: What motivated you to join the organization?

title: Human Resources Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Phone call followed by a full day interview with 3 stakeholders.  All interviews were an hour.   I thought the questions were reasonable and they really wanted to know more about me and my working style  Overall it was a good experience and the staff were very welcoming.
Interview Questions: Why Montefiore?  What interests you about health care?

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Cordial, though not as connected between hiring managers, physicians, and HR as one would hope. The staff were friendly and helpful. The establishment was well-maintained and organized. I was able to get a good feel for the department at that location but a bit less for other locations.
Interview Questions: Why I wanted to work in the particular field.

title: Medical Resident PGY-1 Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New Rochelle, NY)
Interview Descriptions: Applicants are invited to interview throughout the application season. Interviews are behavioral-based and conducted by the medical director and senior staff. They include a guided tour of the facilities with opportunities to meet current staff.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: RN Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Aug 2018
Interview Descriptions: I met with the manager first, in which he asked questions about my dedication, my experience, and my dedication. After I met with the staff members in which they asked me questions about personality, work ethic, and hypothetical situations.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were put in a situation in which you were unfamiliar with?

title: Clinical Laboratory Technologist Interview

title: Clinical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Yonkers, NY) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Advice for Yonkers interviewees:
•	If you are interviewing in Yonkers and are taking Metro-North, go to the Greystone stop. It is much closer to the Montefiore campus than the Yonkers station. No one will tell you this when they send you your interview confirmation.
•	Uber is available to and from the train. No need to walk up to the closest street – they will come down to the train.
•	If you are tempted to put your jacket and interview shoes on in the taxi don’t do it! It’s a windy, twisty road and you will just get knocked around in the cab.
•	And seriously, unless you’re interviewing for the role of CEO or Comptroller, don’t even bother wearing a suit or nice shoes.
•	In any case, there is a lovely Starwood Hotel right next to the complex, where they will offer you free coffee, tea, water, comfy seats, and a nice rest room to change in. Take advantage of this!
•	The Montefiore HR person will likely tell you that you are interviewing at 200 Corporate Road. This is not quite right, and if you’re like me, you’ll be waiting there for a while until someone directs you to a building on the other side of the complex (I think it’s #175).
•	When you finally get to your destination, there will be no one there to greet you. Why do they have the interviews in Yonkers? Couldn’t they do the interviews in the Bronx?? In any case, if you’re lucky, someone will be exiting the building and will let you in. 
•	You might be tempted, at this point, to get a drink of water from the “waiting area” – don’t bother – there are no cups there. You might also be tempted to ask to use a rest room, but again, there won’t be anyone there to greet you to let you in, so there is no one to ask. Ideally, you have had your water and used the restroom at the Starwood Suites (I can’t recommend them highly enough there!)
•	If you’re waiting a long time without anyone coming to greet you, and believe me you will be, you might be tempted to try to contact your HR rep. Again, don’t bother. She won’t answer the phone and then will just send you a snarky note to tell you that she knows you’re there.
•	Another nice person might at this point notice you’ve been sitting there a long time and offer to show you where the interview conference room is. I don’t know if this is necessary, but I took the opportunity to wait in the conference room. My interviewers finally came in about 10 minutes late, dressed super-casually, I might add. I felt like a moron for dressing up for the interview. Lesson learned, I guess.
•	My interviewees would be my managers and seemed uncomfortable with the process. Why not have an HR person there if you are holding interviews at the HR headquarters??? Anyway, cookie-cutter questions: Why you? Why Maimonides? What was your hardest case last year? Snooze… After 35 minutes the interview was over. 
•	Now, if you’re like me, and have to take a day off of work to take the Metro-North ($16.50) up to Yonkers for an interview and pay for an Uber back and forth ($16) from the train, you might want to determine beforehand if this job is a really good fit for you before making this journey. Another lesson learned, I guess? I’m not sure.
•	Having some time to kill after the interview, I went back to Starwood Suites to change my clothes, get another (FREE!) cup of coffee and sit in a comfy chair in blessed air conditioning. The ladies room there has a HUGE garbage bin which was handy for me to toss all the paperwork I had brought with me to make sure I had done ample research on the company. 
•	Seriously, the best part of that day was the time I spent in the Starwood Suite lobby. They were super-awesome there. I should check to see if they need any social workers…
Interview Questions: cookie-cutter questions: Why you? Why Maimonides? What was your hardest case last year?

title: Utilization Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
Received a phone call to schedule an in-person interviews with the hiring manager. Everything went well and was asked typical interview questions. I also asked some of my own questions. 

I received an offer, but I turned it down. I applied and interviewed for an Utilization Management position but received an invitation to apply for another position under the hiring manager.  They wanted me to take a pay cut for a lower-level position but my resume clearly shows that I'm at a mid-career level. Montefiore requires you provide 5 references including your current manager and then sends them a long online survey to rate your skills and abilities. They do think this is excessive and don't care that this could get you fired from your existing job.  When I tried to negotiate salary, the HR recruiter said "not gonna happen". Their whole recruiting process is just so demeaning and dismissive. Everything from the slow response times to the non-negotiable low ball offers. I would not recommend.
Interview Questions: What were the responsibilities of your last position?

title: Senior Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Yonkers, NY) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Probably one of the most laborious processes that I've been through.  Had a phone screen with HR then underwent a video interview.  After that I was then scheduled to come in for an in person interview with 2 associate directors and 2 peers. Upon confirming those interviews, I received an application and an invitation to complete an 80 minute Healthcare Competency Review (basically an IQ test).  Finally interviewed, no one had any idea at the time of the organization structure (so I had no idea if I was even interviewing with the hiring manager).  I was subsequently called back for a 2nd interview, this time VP, Assoc VP and more Directors.  This process took approximately 8 weeks.  Really felt like the applicant's time was not respected and does make me question what it would be like to actually work in this environment.  At no point did anyone who I met tell me how this was a great place to work, only that they are growing, very busy and that it would be challenging work.
Interview Questions: Many of the people you will be working with on projects have very large egos, how would you deal with those difficult personalities?

title: Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Yonkers, NY) in Nov 2016
Interview Descriptions:
The interview was a multiple step process. First, coordinating with the HR department, sending in my resume and cover letter. Then, we scheduled my first "interview" with HR. This was a pretty standard HR interview. Asking about my experiences, why they should consider me, and giving me some context about the organization. Next came the actual interview with possible future bosses. I was interviewed by three Epic senior product managers at once, asking again about my past experience and how it might benefit them. 

From there I "applied" officially to the job posting that they would consider me for. This portion took some time as they were waiting for approvals, budgets, etc. 

Drug tests, on-boarding questions, took awhile as well.

Eventually I heard back and received an offer. Overall it was a good experience.
Interview Questions: What is one example from your past experience when you went above and beyond expectations to deliver a positive change.

HR usually calls you within a week or two to inform you that you were selected for the job. You will need to take a drug test and TB shot. It usually takes a month before you start working.

title: Project Manager - IT Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Yonkers, NY) in Aug 2016
Interview Descriptions:
HR contact, telephone interview {additional rounds F2F}
Initial HR interview was outstanding.
Hiring manager interview was scripted, not conversational, lack of connection; did not give an initial overview of the organization; seemed more tactical than strategic focused.   Interviewer wanted to know more about candidate background, which was great, but there was a lack of clarity to determine where position would make the greatest impact. Did not give overview of types of projects one would be assigned, what the culture, environment was like - except that many groups do not collaborate, which is the hardest challenge in the PM space. Interviewer seemed a bit stressed or overwhelmed while talking about it, also very pressed for time.  Did not feel interviewer took a keen interest, except poking at why landed in different industries, as if project management is not transferrable skill. 
Be a bit more open minded - you never know what kind of gem lurks behind the resume.  First impressions are important.

Interview Descriptions: You apply online at montefiore.org. Then if you are one of the lucky folks or if you know someone that's work at the Hospital, they can vouch for you. You get a call/email to come in to meet the HR person, then the Hiring Manager the same day. If you pass the Interview you will get a call with Job offer then a package in the mail or go in to HR to sign the offer.
Interview Questions: Do you know SCCM?

title: Operations Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Jun 2015
Interview Descriptions: They asked why I thought I would be a good fit. I asked them about what they felt would be my biggest challenges.  What I could offer them. The HR department moves pretty slow and you need to stay on top of them.
Interview Questions: What is the first thing 3 things I would do if I were hired.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Apr 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a challenging experience but the way it was setup was a bit unorganized. The inteviewer's seemed like they had no communication among themselves making the process confusing for all applicants
Interview Questions: Why do you want to switch from senior clerk to IT

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Mar 2015
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the Director of Operations and the Human Resources Manager on the first day. I was called for a second round of interviews and considered for two different positions within the Medical Group. One of the interviews was a Medical Director. Another interview was with an Administrator. The Director of Operations is very nice and at the same time direct and upfront. The other interviewers were also pleasant.
Interview Questions: They asked me about my experience and how I would handle a difficult situation and difficult providers.

title: Healthcare Performance Engineer Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: Got a call by secretary of manager to confirm interview time, then go to the site, which is beautiful.  Finish a writing sample on site within 30 mins and then interviewed by the manager and one guy from engineering team. Lasted for an hour with both technical and behavioral questions.
Interview Questions: How do you calculate the number of calls coming in to the front desk of a small practice without the exact number of calls being monitored?

title: Information Technology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: They responded to my application very promptly. Interview was very standard to what one would expect. They met me at the office and walked me to the interview room. Met with two associates and simply asked me about my resume and prior experience. It was very simple and lasted roughly a half an hour.
Interview Questions: Describe your best quality in one word

title: Customer Service Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: Be ready to fill out a lot of paperwork, but that is as hard as it can get.  Great position to get as soon as you get out of college, better pay than an entry level job in a BA field. It also comes with great perks, and what I liked most is that you can go back for your MBA payed by the union.  A full timer gets 6 free credits each semester, a part-time employee gets just 3.  Still better considering sky rocketing tuition fees.  Like any job the interview process can be intimidating, but remember to stay positive and answer honestly.
Interview Questions: What is one of your strengths as a customer service specialist?

title: Administrative Inter Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: It was a very basic interview with behavioral questions. They mostly asked me questions regarding my resume, but nothing that required detailed responses. One of the questions they asked me was how I could go about gaining group consensus toward creating a change. Another question I was asked was what my weaknesses were. The recruiters are a poor reflection of the organization, because one recruiter would not pronounce my name right no matter how many times I corrected him. It was disrespectful.
Interview Questions: how I could go about gaining group consensus toward creating a change.

title: Unit Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: Took about an hour including the wait time. Interviewer just asked basic questions about experience nothing out of the ordinary. I met with the manager a couple of days after and that interview was just her getting to know me not really an interview, but with HR it was pretty simple.
Interview Questions: Name a time you went above and beyond for a client

title: Administrative Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Basic interview process.  Initial interview phone call, then a face to face with hiring manager,  then recruiter call if position is offeted. Be sure to ask questions as well about location especially if you drive and need parking.
Interview Questions: Can you tell me about your weaknesses and strengths and why you want to work here.

title: Care Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Yonkers, NY) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: Lots of people present.  Asked a lot of questions about things that ultimately did not pertain to the job.  More of a meet and greet experience.  Not very informative about the company or the job itself.  Not very organized about where the interview was heading.
Interview Questions: How would I get along with others

title: Liaison Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Yonkers, NY) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very informal as well as knowledgeable, but a bit misleading.  They tell you that this position can lead to great things, but the one thing they leave out which is a VERY BIG THING is that it can take up to seven years to get promoted or even change positions if you don't know someone internally.  Any who....the interviewer ask your basic interview questions as well as verifies your work history and why you would like to work for Montefiore.  If you make it through interview one, you receive a call and they ask you to report to a Yonkers, NY location to fill out a massive amount of paperwork including payroll before you officially are hired.  You speak with an HR rep who basically details you on the position and feeds you the same crap they first interviewer feeds you then gives you an orientation date and a schedule of things you have to complete before the orientation which includes drug screening and a TVB shot in which you have to schedule at one of their locations and you have to get the shot one day then wait a few days and go back for the results.  If the results come back negative the doctor will sign off on it and all the paperwork you received on the interview journey you have to take with you to orientation on the date given at the given location to be stamped and that ends the interview process.  My advise to anyone seeking this position....MAKE SURE YOU HAVE A CRYSTAL CLEAR BACKGROUND!  They will use even the smallest thing against you even if it happened ten years prior to your interview with no felony attached.
Interview Questions: What can you offer Montefiore?

title: General Surgeon Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: The guy interviewed me. He was really nice and respectful. A trauma rolled in as I was walking out so he had to attend to it and cut it short.
Interview Questions: Where did you go to school

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Went on an interview where I was interviewed by 3 managers from 3 different units, then got called in a month later to take a basic pharm exam at HR, and then interviewed with someone from recruiting the same day as the exam and she offered me the job.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years

title: RN I Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: Met with a nurse recruiter, took a 30 question basic nursing/math quiz, then met with a nurse manager.
Interview Questions: Asked a lot about my resume, group/conflict experience, if you had made a medication error before

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Apr 2014
Interview Descriptions: Unit Manager and Assistant Manager both interviewed me at the same time with different questions (critical thinking) outside the box. Gave a tour of the unit. Asked why I wanted to work there.
Interview Questions: What would you do if a patient needed to use the bathroom but no aids are around at the moment but you had to give a medication, what would you do

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Mar 2014
Interview Descriptions: I interview with HR and after that she called the floor manager and I meet with her a couple of days letter. HR had a professional straight to business approach to it. With the manager it was more laid back.
Interview Questions: It was a customer service base question on how would you handle this situation.

title: Programmer Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Yonkers, NY) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: Dreadful, I should have known better. Late for their own phone screen, then put you on hold, rudeness. Late for their own in person interview and then let others interrupt meeting. rude.
Interview Questions: Traveling to other hospitals

title: Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was smooth but took longer than necessary. I met with the hiring manager who knew exactly what she wanted in a candidate and was straight to the point. But HR took forever to finalize the process.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest strength?

title: Telecommunications Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Sept 2013
Interview Descriptions: The interview was rather quickly, as for the hiring process was a bit long. Due to background check, drug testing, education testing and work referral. Orientations is a requirement as well in order to be hired.
Interview Questions: How well am i at multitask?

title: Pharmacy Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY)
Interview Descriptions: I applied online mid January, at some point in February I was asked to come in and take a pharmacy tech exam, pretty basic, a few days later I was asked to come in and take a second exam. After doing so, I had my first interview with the hiring director of pharmacy a few weeks later. My interview was scheduled at 12 noon. I was there from 11:45 until about 2:15 pm and there was still another candidate to be interviewed before me (his secretary confirmed he was slow). I rescheduled and finally had an interview with him, for him to tell me there's been a hiring freeze and to contact him in 3 weeks. 3 weeks and 3 emails later he still does not reply but I receive an email from the secretary of the director of pharmacy on the main campus scheduling an interview (this comes about 2 1/2 months after I applied). I had an interview with her then immediately had a panel interview with 3 pharmacy managers, went pretty well. I send out thank you emails to everyone I've interviewed with and no reply from anyone. Another two months later, one of the managers from the panel interview wanted to interview me again. I was quite surprised being that he was the only manager asking questions during the panel interview. This now being my fourth interview, went pretty good as well, sent my thank you note. two to three weeks later I follow up to find out they chose someone else. Four interviews in over almost a 6 month period and no offer. i was pretty livid. No consideration or courtesy from any of the staff, except the secretaries.
Interview Questions: What did you do when you've seen someone violating company policy

title: Senior Marketing Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical
Interview Descriptions: I had a great interview with the VP of Marketing at that time. I really enjoyed his tact and thoughtfulness. The interviews with the medical leadership were just a pass by interview, not very in-depth. I did not get the feeling they really valued marketing.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Physician Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received an email from my school about possible job opportunities at montefiore and then i sent my resume. I was then contacted for an interview within about a week. The man interviewing me was a fellow physician assistant but was the head of the department. He was friendly and the conversation was smooth. He was not intimidating at all. I was then given a tour of the department.
Interview Questions: He told me that the competition was between me and another candidate that had more experience and then he asked why he should pick me?

title: Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews
Interview Questions: Why did you choose this hospital

title: PC Support Remote Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: I was hired over the phone. I was explained what the job was in detail. I was told who i would deal with and the sites i would support. I was told i would be given training for the first month at the Moses Campus working with the Desktop Service request group. I would learn all the IT ways and shadow the employees. I would handle tickets and how to use the software CA Service manager. I would then work with the remote technicians going to remote sites and how to handle them. I would be given a laptop,label maker and net work tester.
Interview Questions: How would i handle a difficult client?

title: Senior Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Yonkers, NY) in Feb 2013
Interview Descriptions: Long wait for call backs but the employees at HR were very nice. They helped with not making the process nerve wrecking. Once interviewed they made me feel comfortable with the outcome.
Interview Questions: If hired how could you help the company?

title: Food Service Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Dec 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was a pleasant experience. Hr. seemed to be on point with direct questioning and 3 stage process of interviewing with professionals. The waiting period was the longest, but their response was very up skilled.
Interview Questions: What would be the right protocol that I would implement, when a union member needs discipline

title: Administrative Supervisor Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Oct 2012
Interview Descriptions: Brought in my an agency, to interview for a temp to perm position.  The interview was with the Business Manager.   The interviewer had my resume and knew my credentials, I had the impression, she knew who she was planning to hire.  The interview lasted 15 minutes.
Interview Questions: Questions weren't difficult and gave no indication of any interest in credentials or skills.  Rather the focus was on being on call 7 days a week, and demonstrating attention to detail in difficult situations.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Straightforward. Submit resume online.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Unit Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the manager of the unit along with three of the staff members. I then had a follow up interview with an HR manager, background and drug test. Once I got the job had a week of orientation and three months probation period. Interview process was timely however, it was worth it.
Interview Questions: How would you handle yourself in a fast paced environment such as this with patients, doctors and family members and incoming phone calls ?

title: Human Resources Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Arrived on time for the interview and was kept waiting 2 hours. Upon arrival a woman at reception desk told me I was in the wrong place and the person I was scheduled to be interviewed by did not work there. Her story changed when I produced the email. During the 2 hour wait to be interviewed, office staff came out walking buy but not speaking. Not once was there an explanation why I was waiting so long. I asked the receptionist why the wait and she said, "All I can do is to tell them you are here." A woman finally appeared and she was so nasty I wondered why they bothered to call me in for an interview. I was interviewing for a management position and the person interviewing me was unable to discuss the current structure of the department that would directly impact my answers as to how I would run the department. I felt as if there was no job and that I was being pumped for information.  I left with a very negative impression of this staff but was not surprised as I was warned by other Glass Door reviews I read before the interview. If I had it to do over I would have passed. I left thinking what a horrible place to work.
Interview Questions: Why do you really want to work here?

title: Clinical Research Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: All went smoothly without any difficulty. The process too several days and was a combination of telephone interview, 1:1 interview, discussion of skills, explanation of expectations. There really is not more to add to this statement, but we are required to provide a 50 word minimum.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (New York, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Met with the nurse manager. it was a panel interview with about 6 people. Manager was very friendly and asked some basic questions about me. A week after that i met with the HR. Interview wast so difficult, just remain confident and you'll be fine. The entire process took a month to be hired
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself, why nursing

title: ACO Project Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Yonkers, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, week later I got telephone from corporate recruiter asking me to come for 1:1 interview to their location. Came on the scheduled date and first I was given paper application to fill - it took me half an hour because I was ask to give all license numbers etc and I had to get it from the internet (I have used my phone to do so). When I completed application I was invited to the office where I had two on one interview with a co-worker of recruiter. Interview was easy but during it recruiter changed position to different one. I agreed. When we finished interview I was told that I will be contacted in regards to new position. After two weeks I got a regular mail saying "Thank you but no thank you" no explanation given.
Interview Questions: Typical questions, nothing fancy.

title: Construction Electrician Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: the interview was based on general electrical code questions and some electrical diagrams and blueprints, i was also taken on several job sites and performed conduit bending methods after the practice i was put on a 90 day probationary contingency and then after completion was hired permanently.
Interview Questions: they asked me about an employee at another institution they knew who worked with me directly.

title: Systems Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Yonkers, NY) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: It is a two to three stage interview process including drug test and health evaluation. General questions asked on the interview. Patient Care must come first. You might meet with 2 or more managers. Ask alot of questions
Interview Questions: How do you feel working in a hospital environment?

title: Staff Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Feb 2012
Interview Descriptions: HR at Montefiore is really not very good. You must keep on top of them to make sure you are given the money you deserve for your years of experience.
Interview Questions: Many repetitive questions from the recruiters after you meet with the management and staff of a unit. Not sure how relevent it is for HR to do a full interview when you interview with multiple levels of management in nursing and physicians.

title: Business Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: A third party recruiter arranged for an interview with the Director of the department. I had an initial telephone interview with the director. He asked me about my background and what I did in my previous positions. He also asked leading questions regarding my analytical skills looking for me to present insightful comments. He also asked about my technological capabilities and which healthcare financial association and government agencies I was involved with or depended on for regulations. He then recommended that we meet in person and I would be contacted by the recruiter. We meet personally and he suggested what I might earn in this position. There after I meet with an HR rep and he made an offer over the phone a week afterwards.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical in Jul 2011
Interview Descriptions: Simple and straight forward.  No particularly difficult questions as long as you have the knowledge base.  If you know your info as a nurse it should be fine.
Interview Questions: They asked questions on how to document specific scenarios.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical in Feb 2011
Interview Descriptions: You will meet with HR first.  You will have to take a short math exam (pharmacology calculations).  You will then meet with the manager of the floor you have applied to.
Interview Questions: Describe a moment when you had a communication issue with a patient and how you were able to overcome the issue.

title: Financial Representative Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Montefiore Medical (Bronx, NY) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions: easy
Interview Questions: what are 3 neg qualities about urself
